channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Columbia University President Minouche Shafik resigns after 'period of turmoil'
item.content:encoded: (Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Wally Amos, creator of Famous Amos cookies, has died
item.description: The creator of the grocery store snack aisle staple died at 88. His family said in a statement that he had dementia.
item.content:encoded:
The creator of the grocery store snack aisle staple died at 88. His family said in a statement that he had dementia.

(Image credit: Lucy Pemoni)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Instagram fails to protect female politicians from violent, racist, sexist comments
item.description: A new report that shows a deluge of misogynistic, racist and violent comments targeting Kamala Harris and female politicians on Instagram. Meta recently slimmed down its content moderation teams.
item.content:encoded: A new report that shows a deluge of misogynistic, racist and violent comments targeting Kamala Harris and female politicians on Instagram. Meta recently slimmed down its content moderation teams.
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Former CNN executive is on a mission to revive 'The Atlanta Journal Constitution'
item.description: Former top CNN executive Andrew Morse has splashy plans to revive The Atlanta Journal Constitution, a local newspaper. Could it work?
item.content:encoded: Former top CNN executive Andrew Morse has splashy plans to revive The Atlanta Journal Constitution, a local newspaper. Could it work?
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Venezuela has arrested thousands in the weeks since controversial election
item.description: Venezuela's autocratic leader is cracking down on dissent. Hundreds have been arrested and lawmakers are moving to shutdown social media sites and close non-governmental agencies.
item.content:encoded: Venezuela's autocratic leader is cracking down on dissent. Hundreds have been arrested and lawmakers are moving to shutdown social media sites and close non-governmental agencies.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Inflation fell in July, and interest rates could drop in September
item.description: Inflation fell to its lowest level in more than three years in July. Consumer prices were up 2.9% from July 2023, clearing the way for the Federal Reserve to start cutting interest rates in September.
item.content:encoded: Inflation fell to its lowest level in more than three years in July. Consumer prices were up 2.9% from July 2023, clearing the way for the Federal Reserve to start cutting interest rates in September.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Ukraine attacks a second region in Western Russia, prompting a state of emergency
item.description: Ukrainian forces attack a second border region in western Russia, where the governor declares a state of emergency. Ukraine also targets air bases in at least a half-dozen regions.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian forces attack a second border region in western Russia, where the governor declares a state of emergency. Ukraine also targets air bases in at least a half-dozen regions.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: The Opposition in Venezuela is Afraid
item.description: Following a disputed election in Venezuela, autocratic president Nicolàs Maduro is cracking down on the opposition. Thousands have been arrested and lawmakers are threatening social media sites and planning to close down civic groups. We hear from opponents of Maduro.
item.content:encoded:
Following a disputed election in Venezuela, autocratic president Nicolàs Maduro is cracking down on the opposition. Thousands have been arrested and lawmakers are threatening social media sites and planning to close down civic groups. We hear from opponents of Maduro.

(Image credit: Jesus Vargas)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: WHO declares mpox emergency of international concern
item.description: On Wednesday, the WHO said an outbreak of mpox in several African countries is serous enough to constitute a public health emergency of international concern.
item.content:encoded: On Wednesday, the WHO said an outbreak of mpox in several African countries is serous enough to constitute a public health emergency of international concern.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: A cautionary tale of new online banking systems
item.description: When a little-known tech company failed, thousands of people couldn’t access the millions they deposited into financial technology companies. Here's what the industry reveals about banking regulation.
item.content:encoded: When a little-known tech company failed, thousands of people couldn’t access the millions they deposited into financial technology companies. Here's what the industry reveals about banking regulation.
item.dc:creator: Erika Beras
